rComments: Amazing. 80% is an A (not A- but A) & she is really receptive to student needs. After asking us why we felt our midterm scores were low & finding out that timing was an issue, she decided to make the final only 3 pgs & let us see the first 2 pgs early. Love that she implements changes WITHIN the quarter & not waiting until next quarter to start.

Although she posts lots of material early and records her lectures (thank you!), she's not big on communication regarding assignments, so it's easy to miss points. Really not a great lecturer either- I knew a lot of the material covered already, but her explanations were scattered and confusing. :/ Really didn't work well with the way I learn.

Textbook was useless, study her lecture notes. Friday activities while not mandatory were helpful. Section is required for participation. 4 midterms, 1 final. Grades by keywords.  C to C- avg. Attend her OH and TA OH's (very helpful). Otherwise, review her webcast and notememorize everything thats covered (more detailed than her notes).

I am more than certain she had test questions from Bio 115. WHY?? This class was much harder than it should have been. Majority of the test had questions with very little to do with the lectures and mostly covers the activity she does on Fridays and the problem set to which no solutions are provided (also from Bio 115). Some curve, clicker, 5 exams
Boring voice, boring lectures, confusing

Jurica has an exhausting, raspy voice that makes lectures very slow to get through. Material wise, this is an experimental class so if you work in a research lab already you should be ahead of everyone else. Really tough to get an A but you should manage to get a B. Exams are tough and tricky so study hard.
Hard class because she makes it too hard. In her own words "I don't expect anyone to get an A on this test."

Euk is a very demanding class. That being said, Jurica was a decent professor. Her exams were not exactly representative of her practice exams or homework. Lectures were rather slow and boring; her voice can get very tiring and she often only briefly mentions key concepts which is frustrating.
Extremely disorganized, exams are harder than she makes them out to be, and should probably stick to not teaching and focusing on her research instead. Wouldn'nt recommend her.
extremely boring and difficult teacher but very smart.... should stick to not teaching.

Her test are hard and tricky. Understand all of the concepts that she gives, practice as much as you can, and know her expectations. Don't underestimate how much power that she has over your grade because she is a professor that will never give anyone an  A on the exams. She is a really awesome professor and she really knows her stuff.

Professor Jurica is the best professors I have had on campus. She is very dedicated to the class and does everything to make the information accessible to students. She is very approachable and willing to answer all questions. She tries to make the class a great learning experience and expects you to be able to apply the knowledge learned.
Hard tests but good teacher. Very patient and willing to explain everything, even the same concept multiple times if you don't understand it.
she is hot and smart- im in euk. heaven :)

Very tech savvy (online discussion board, podcasts, lots of resources on website) PATRICK YUH is the best TA ever, office hours helpful - this class is hard no matter what, take it with Jurica if you can.  She is going to win a Nobel for the spliceosome.  Look it up.

Melissa was a straight forward prof. She's pretty smart too (I think). Yes- lectures were boring and full of information. It's not her though; the way the class is designed makes it tough-->eukaryotes are just complicated! Toughest class in bio probably...don't go into the class defeated! Put in work (a lot of it) and get friendly with the notes.

Never attended class (podcasts of lecture were made available and were VERY helpful) but got a decent grade. Attend sections to get the HW done because it will help you get a feel for how she will ask Q's on the test. Test have some real challenging experimental/application problems but I struggled with these and still did well in the class.

Good lecturer. Tests were difficult but about 20% from sample tests/HW. You must know everything she teaches though, you will be tested on anything and everything. People fail her class not because she is a poor teacher but they can not meet her expectations, although there is a LARGE volume of information that is expected to be learned.

This professor is extreamly boring! Finaly a women teaching a science course (the first in all my years here) but she is DULL! Not just that she really doesn't teach anything she just reads off her already prepared slides. She even made mistakes during lecture. She should take some ideas and make her lectures more endearing.

I regret ever taking the class and sitting through her lame lectures and droning voice. It isn't worth it, and if you can avoid it i would suggest taking it with someone else. Total waste of time. I didn't like her at all.

Lecture slides online and recorded lectures were available, but only did little help to the volume of materials that were covered. Very difficult tests--questions on experiments were tricky and materials tested were hardly discussed. She expects you to think beyond of what is required of you to know. Office hours helpful.
Her lectures are boring and long, tests are very difficult and tricky. The material is super hard, and this class would be a good reason to switch from MCD to regular bio major in my opinion.

Jurica's lectures are incredibly boring and difficult to understand.  She focuses a lot on experimental technique.  Exams are very tricky, she will include things she barely talked about.  She is, however, very approachable and helpful.
You better pay attention to her comments, shes  a tricky one
